meanings.meaning: 1. gō; traditional unit of volume, approx. 180 ml
2. gō; traditional unit of area, approx 0.33 square meters
3. one-tenth of the distance from the base to the summit of a mountain

4. conjunction Astronomy, See also 衝もちろん、実際に「はやぶさ」が太陽に近づいているわけではなく、図のように地球から見て太陽の反対側に位置するだけですが、このような現象を「合」と呼びます。Of course "Hayabusa" is not actually closing in on the Sun, it is just positioned as in the figure so that, seen from the Earth, it is on the opposite side of the Sun; this is called 'conjunction'.
5. sum; total See also 合計
6. synthesis (in dialectics) Philosophy, See also 総合, See also 正反合
7. minor premise (in hetuvidya)
8. counter for covered containers
9. counter for matches, battles, etc.
10. Gō (unit) The gō is a traditional Japanese unit of area and volume.... Read more

sentences.translation: Of course "Hayabusa" is not actually closing in on the Sun, it is just positioned as in the figure so that, seen from the Earth, it is on the opposite side of the Sun; this is called 'conjunction'.

meanings.meaning: 1. to come together; to merge; to unite; to meet このチョッキは前が合わない。This waistcoat won't meet at the front.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'u' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to fit; to match; to suit; to agree with; to be correct この白いコートはあなたによく合うでしょう。This white coat will look very nice on you.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'u' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to be profitable; to be equitable

meanings.type: Auxiliary verb, Godan verb with 'u' ending
meanings.meaning: 4. to do ... to each other; to do ... together after the -masu stem of a verb２人の女性はお互い微笑みあった。The two ladies smiled at each other.
合う 【おう】
おう: Irregular kana usage.

meanings.meaning: 1. passing (an exam); pass; success; passing grade 私の兄は試験に合格できなかった。My brother failed to pass the examination.
2. meeting (specifications, standards, etc.); passing (inspection); qualification; being found eligible 新車はテストを受けて首尾よく合格した。The new car underwent its tests successfully.
1. passing (an exam); pass; success; passing grade 私の兄は試験に合格できなかった。My brother failed to pass the examination.
2. meeting (specifications, standards, etc.); passing (inspection); qualification; being found eligible 新車はテストを受けて首尾よく合格した。The new car underwent its tests successfully.

sentences.translation: My brother failed to pass the examination.
The new car underwent its tests successfully.

meanings.meaning: 1. to match (rhythm, speed, etc.) あなたの計画を私に合わせなさい。Your plan must fit in with mine.
2. to join together; to unite; to combine; to add up ３人は合わせて５０ポンド持っていた。The three men had £50 between them.
3. to face; to be opposite (someone) See also 顔を合わせる
4. to compare; to check with 君の答えを彼の答えと合わせてみなさい。Check your answers with his.
5. to cause to meet (e.g. an unpleasant fate) See also 遭う
6. to place together; to connect; to overlap かれらは彼の両足を縛りあわせた。They bound his legs together.
7. to mix; to combine
8. to put blade to blade; to fight
併せる 【あわせる】、合せる 【あわせる】

sentences.translation: Your plan must fit in with mine.
The three men had £50 between them.
Check your answers with his.
They bound his legs together.
